alfredsnippet.snippet:
Herbert Dingle, The Scientific Outlook in 1851 and in 1951, The British Journal for the Philosophy of Science, Vol II, August, 1951, No. 6, p.85-104

"There is no easier way to construct a completely self-satisfying philosophy of science than to be ignorant of history."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Dingle on Ignorance of History
